meanings.definition: A meeting in which someone is asked questions to determine their suitability for a job or other position.
meanings.sent1: During the interview, the manager asked about my work experience.
meanings.sent2: She prepared well for the job interview by researching the company.
meanings.sent3: At the interview, the candidate accidentally spilled water on the interviewer.
meanings.sent4: The interview felt like a spotlight shining on all my qualifications.
meanings.sent5: The interview room was filled with nervous energy as candidates awaited their turn.

meanings.definition: A conversation between a journalist and someone whose opinions or statements are being sought.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity gave an exclusive interview to the magazine.
meanings.sent2: The journalist conducted the interview with professionalism and respect.
meanings.sent3: During the interview, the interviewee shared a funny anecdote.
meanings.sent4: The interview with the politician revealed surprising insights.
meanings.sent5: The interview captured the essence of the artist's creative process.

meanings.definition: To have a formal meeting with someone in order to ask them questions.
meanings.sent1: I will interview the candidate tomorrow for the marketing position.
meanings.sent2: The police officer needs to interview the witness to gather more information.
meanings.sent3: Let's interview the expert to get more details on the topic.
meanings.sent4: She decided to interview the author for her school project.
meanings.sent5: The journalist will interview the scientist about the new discovery.
